title: Systems Thinking-Based Curriculum Redesign for Sustainability Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic ecology concepts, scientific thinking skills, and proficiency in digital tool utilization
context.additional_context: Learners study curriculum design methodologies integrating systems thinking and sustainability concepts, applying them to real-world problem-solving via mobile microlearning

learning_goals: Learners can analyze sustainability challenges in educational organizations from three or more perspectives using systems thinking tools.
Learners can construct a curriculum design framework applying biomimetic principles (mimicry of biological systems).
Learners can propose an assessment system that incorporates system dynamics (feedback loops, time delays, etc.) in project-based evaluations
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
